name: Fedlex
description: The official publishing platform for Swiss federal law. It exposes the Classified Compilation of legislation as a hierarchical concept scheme, allowing navigation through Swiss legal domains (Systematic Collection of Federal Law).

name: AGROVOC
description: Maintained by the FAO (UN), this is a massive multilingual thesaurus covering agriculture, forestry, fisheries, food, and related environmental concepts.

name: BnF
description: The National Library of France. It hosts RAMEAU, the primary subject heading authority for French libraries, along with extensive concepts regarding authors, works, and periods.

name: DBpedia
description: The semantic extraction of Wikipedia. It serves as a general knowledge hub, defining millions of entities and concepts that are linked to external thesauri (like YAGO or Wikidata).

name: NERC Vocabulary Server
description: Managed by the British Oceanographic Data Centre. It provides standard vocabularies for oceanography and earth sciences, used globally to tag marine data.

name: Legilux
description: The official legal portal of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg. It provides access to legislation and the 'MÃ©morial' (official journal) using a structured legal vocabulary.

name: EU Publications Office
description: The CELLAR repository of the EU Publications Office. It hosts EU Vocabularies including EuroVoc, corporate bodies, countries, languages, and other authority tables used across EU institutions.

name: Nobel Prize
description: The official linked dataset of the Nobel Foundation. It contains concepts regarding the prize categories (Physics, Peace, etc.), laureates, and their affiliations.
